meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a reed
meanings.sent1: The tall, thin grass in the field looked reedy in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The musician played a reedy tune on the clarinet.
meanings.sent3: The reedy plant whispered secrets to the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as reedy as the rustling reeds by the pond.
meanings.sent5: The reedy texture of the fabric reminded her of soft, swaying reeds.

meanings.sent1: The reedy voice of the child carried across the playground.
meanings.sent2: The old radio emitted a reedy sound when turned on.
meanings.sent3: The reedy meow of the kitten made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The reedy whistle of the tea kettle signaled it was ready.
meanings.sent5: The reedy chirping of the birds filled the morning air with music.

meanings.sent1: The reedy marsh was home to many frogs and insects.
meanings.sent2: The boat glided through the reedy waters of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The reedy shoreline provided a perfect hiding spot for the ducks.
meanings.sent4: The reedy landscape stretched as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The reedy area was a haven for wildlife seeking shelter.
